items.preText: Thanks, Shashank. Imrul Kayes and Liton Das to open, Kyle Jarvis has the new ball. A wide slip in place. We're not far from the first ball. This is a good time to say hello to Hemant Brar. Steve Rhodes, the Bangladesh coach: "White ball cricket - to beat West Indies in both formats with the white ball, I was super impressed. Asia Cup, I think we could've played better, disappointed to lose the final but the guys came up with a superb effort. For the moment, a lot of the guys are going through a learning process." Ashik Mahmud: "Putting out talent like Shanto after only 3 matches is not justifiable. " Arun says: "Save for the exclusion of Cremer and the captaincy of Masakadza, this is the best Zimbabwe eleven possible. Finally sanity prevails in selection. The XIs for you Bangladesh: 1 Liton Das, 2 Imrul Kayes, 3 Fazle Mahmud, 4 Mushfiqur Rahim (wk), 5 Mohammad Mithun, 6 Mahmudullah, 7 Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 8 Mohammad Saifuddin, 9 Mashrafe Mortaza (capt), 10 Nazmul Islam, 11 Mustafizur Rahman Zimbabwe: 1 Hamilton Masakadza (capt), 2 Cephas Zhuwao, 3 Craig Ervine, 4 Brendan Taylor (wk), 5 Sean Williams, 6 Peter Moor, 7 Sikandar Raza, 8 Donald Tiripano, 9 Brandon Mavuta, 10 Kyle Jarvis, 11 Tendai Chatara 30-year old Fazle Mahmud debuts for Bangladesh. Selector Habibul Bashar thinks he is a complete package. He's a middle order batsman who made his debut in 2004, started off as a big-hitter but has mellowed down since into a build-an-innings batsman. Bangladesh win toss, opt to bat Not really a surprise considering how slow the surfaces in Mirpur have tended to be under lights. 1.50pm Bangladesh have a number of injury concerns. Shakib's recurring finger injury has ruled him out for another three months, while Tamim is yet to recover from the knuckle fracture he sustained after being struck by Suranga Lakmal in the opening Asia Cup match. Mashrafe and Mushfiqur have only recently recovered from injuries sustained in the same tournament, and neither is 100% fit. Even Mahmudullah was struggling with a little rib pain earlier this month. 1.30pm Warm welcome all. It's the start of Bangladesh's home winter. As they say, after the famine comes the feast. From the ball-by-ball team today, we've got myself, Shashank Kishore, and Hemant Brar to take you through the action as it unfolds in Mirpur. If you want to switch over to the India-West Indies ODI from time-to-time, not far away in Guwahati, you can join Deiva Muthu. We all know how strong Bangladesh are at home and this is an opportunity to firm up their plans for the 2019 World Cup. Zimbabwe, meanwhile, are coming off a tough, winless tour of South Africa - as you'd expect, if I may add - and here's an opportunity to showcase some improvements, perhaps even win. Over the years, they've had a number of famous contests. Can this series produce thrilling cricket?
items.text: short of length outside off, dabbed towards cover-point by Liton
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: another short of length ball, some extra bounce this time, Liton adjusts well to guide it towards third man. Bangladesh are off the mark
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: once again short of length, angling across the left-hander. A tentative push by Imrul towards point
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length ball, much closer to the body this time, punched with a little bit more confidence, in the direction of cover
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length ball, around off stump, Imrul comes forward and defends it right under his eyes
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length again, fourth stump line, pushed towards mid-off
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length ball, just outside off, dabbed towards point
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, no run

items.text: a missed run-out chance. Length ball, Liton dabs it towards point and sets off, Sean Williams was quick to the ball and had all the time in the world to aim and throw. Liton had given up completely but Williams misses the stumps
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, no run

items.text: down the leg side and called a wide
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, 1 wide

items.text: once again on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg for a single
items.shortText: Chatara to Liton Das, 1 run

items.text: fuller and wider outside off, Imrul goes up and over cover for the first boundary of the innings
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, FOUR runs

items.text: length outside off, defended this time
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length ball but on the pads once more, tucked away by Liton towards fine leg for a run
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: almost chopped on! It was a length ball, Imrul was looking to force it on the off side, gets an inside edge that just evades the stumps
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: fuller, outside off, Imrul comes forward and opens the face of the bat to run it past the second slip, the third man fielder cuts it off
items.shortText: Jarvis to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: length outside off, comes forward and defends towards cover
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: short of length outside off, Liton was looking to pull it squarer, but misses it altogether
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length outside off, Liton watches it before letting it go, some late seam movement there for Jarvis
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: a tad fuller this time and pushed uppishly towards short cover where Raza takes it but signals straightaway to the umpires to refer it upstairs. The soft signal is out. It's close but he seems to have his fingers underneath the ball. They need a conclusive evidence to rule this not out. But the third umpire thinks the ball touched the grass there and Liton survives
items.shortText: Jarvis to Liton Das, no run

items.text: length outside off and Imrul has a wild swing at it, misses it completely
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: a touch fuller and straighter, just outside off, defended
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: short of length outside off, some extra bounce there for Chatara. Defended towards covers
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: short of length outside off, driven towards point but straight to the fielder
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.preText: brickhillj: "Great Sportsmanship from Raza! A dying quality in competitive cricket."
items.text: extra bounce, it jumps from short of a length and surprises Imrul who was looking to fend at it, gets hit near the shoulder
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: length outside off, Imrul looks to go aerial but misses completely
items.shortText: Chatara to Imrul Kayes, no run
